snippet: South Dakota became the first state to enact a law explicitly authorizing school employees to carry guns on the job, under a measure signed Friday by Gov. Dennis Daugaard.
abstract: South Dakota becomes first state in nation to enact law explicitly authorizing school employees to carry guns on the job; measure, signed by Gov Dennis Daugaard, comes amid passionate nationwide debate over arming teachers.
lead_paragraph: South Dakota became the first state to enact a law explicitly authorizing school employees to carry guns on the job, under a measure signed Friday by Gov. Dennis Daugaard.

headline.seo: South Dakota Passes Law to Let School Employees Carry Guns
headline.main: A State Backs Guns in Class for Teachers
headline.print_headline: A State Backs Guns in Class For Teachers
